run into somebody/something.translation[: to start to experience a difficult or unpleasant situation
He ran into criticism after remarks he made in a television interview.
The business ran into financial difficulties almost immediately.
to reach an amount of several hundred, several thousand etc
The cost of repairing the damage could run into millions.
The list ran into hundreds of pages.
to hit someone or something with a vehicle
He ran into the back of another car.
Guess who I ran into in town today!
shareholders who sue when institutions run into financial difficulties
to reach an amount of several hundred, several thousand etc
Attorneysâ€™ fees can run into tens of millions of dollars in business litigation.
to harm or destroy a company by using too much of its money
I got tired of seeing guys run banks into the ground and then leave with a massive fortune.
